justification: The Methods section states: "Felt ambivalence.  The Felt Ambivalence Questionnaire (Priester & Petty, 1996) measured metacognitive awareness of ambivalence about the self-generated topic."

measured_by: split semantic-differential scales with Thompson et al.’s formula
justification: Under "Potential ambivalence" the authors note: "We employed two split semantic differential scales (Kaplan, 1972)… We computed potential ambivalence utilizing Thompson et al. (1995)'s formula."
The article reports: "Recurrence. A three-item scale measured the perceived extent to which experiences of ambivalence about the self-generated topic recur."

For coping motivation the authors write: "Motivation for effortful coping. We devised a scale… Four items measured the motivation to engage in effortful problem-focused coping (adapted from Carver et al., 1989; DeMarree et al., 2014…)."

measured_by: Concern with Future Consequences subscale of the Consideration of Future Consequences scale
justification: The text explains: "Future orientation. We employed the subscale Concern with Future Consequences from a revised two-factor solution of the Consideration of Future Consequences scale (Joireman et al., 2012; Strathman et al., 1994)."
In the Measures section: "Importance… perceived importance of the self-generated attitude object was assessed with one item… ‘To what extent is the topic important to you?’"

measured_by: single semantic-differential item for positive aspects
justification: The authors note they "separately assess negative and positive evaluations… ‘Considering only the positive aspects… how positive are your thoughts and/or feelings regarding the topic?’"

measured_by: single semantic-differential item for negative aspects
justification: The paired item is described: "‘Considering only the negative aspects… how negative are your thoughts and/or feelings regarding the topic?’"
